sentences: Mal Hallett (born 1893, Roxbury, Massachusetts â€“ died November 20, 1952, Boston) was an American jazz violinist and bandleader.
He played in France during World War I as a member of Al Moore's orchestra, and led his own band, primarily in New England, for much of the 1930s.

His ensemble featured a large number of sidemen who went on to become noted for their own achievements, including Gene Krupa, Jack Teagarden, Frankie Carle, Jack Jenney, Toots Mondello, Irene Daye, Floyd O'Brien, Spud Murphy, Boots Mussulli, Brad Gowans, Turk Murphy, Teddy Grace, John Williams, and Don Fagerquist.
